intro: Strychnos alvimiana, commonly known as the Indian strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are toxic due to the presence of alkaloids such as strychnine and brucine. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
